Class GameState

java.lang.Object
com.shiroyama.chess2.chessboard.controller.GameState
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor
public class GameState extends Object implements com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor
Represents the state of the ChessBoard and manages user input. This class manages current turn, game board, valid moves and selected pieces.

    • GameState

      public GameState(int size, ChessBoard board, float centerX, float centerY)
      Constructor for the class
      Parameters:
      size - the size of the game board
      board - the ChessBoard object representing the game board
      centerX - the x-coordinate of the board's center
      centerY - the y-coordinate of the board's center

    • touchDown

      public boolean touchDown(int x, int y, int pointer, int button)
      Handles mouse click input to the game board.
      Specified by:
      touchDown in interface com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the touch
      y - the y-coordinate of the touch
      pointer - the pointer for the event
      button - the button that was pressed
      Returns:
      true if the input was process, false otherwise
